identificationModule.briefTitle: Systematic ECG Screening for Atrial Fibrillation Among 75 Year Old Subjects in the Region of Stockholm and Halland, Sweden
identificationModule.officialTitle: Systematic ECG Screening for Atrial Fibrillation Among 75 Year Old Subjects in the Region of Stockholm and Halland, Sweden.

descriptionModule.briefSummary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether screening for atrial fibrillation by intermittent ECG recording and initiation of anticoagulation treatment among high risk individuals is cost-effective and can lower the incidence of stroke.

armGroups.label: ECG screening
armGroups.description: Twice daily screening using intermittent ECG recorder (Zenicor) for two weeks
interventionNames: Other: ECG screening for atrial fibrillation using intermittent ECG recorder

interventions.name: ECG screening for atrial fibrillation using intermittent ECG recorder
interventions.description: ECG screening for atrial fibrillation with intermittent ECG recording (Zenicor device) for 14 days. Introduction of anticoagulants in the case of atrial fibrillation.

primaryOutcomes.measure: Ischaemic or haemorrhagic stroke, systemic embolism, major bleeding leading to hospitalization or death from any cause
primaryOutcomes.description: A composite endpoint of incidence of ischamemic and haemorrhagic stroke, incidence of systemic embolism, major bleeding requiring hospitalization and all cause mortality in the group randomized to screening compared to the control group
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Five years. Interim analysis after 3 years.

secondaryOutcomes.description: Incidence of ischaemic stroke in the group randomized to screening compared to the control group
secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Five years. Interim analysis after 3 years.

secondaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Five years. Interim analysis after 3 years.

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Men and women 75-76 years of age living in the region of Stockholm or Halland

Exclusion Criteria:

* Not fulfilling the inclusion criteria
